code: @Manual{,   title = {filtro: Tools for Feature Selection Using Supervised Filter-Based Methods},   author = {Frances Lin and Max Kuhn and Emil Hvitfeldt},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {https://tidymodels.github.io/filtro}, }

title: Tools for Feature Selection Using Supervised Filter-Based Methods
text: goal filtro apply filter-based supervised feature selection methods. methods score feature relevance using metrics p-values, correlation, importance scores. package offers tools score, rank, select top features using built-functions desirability2 package, supports streamlined preprocessing within tidymodels workflows like recipes package.

what: Compute F-statistic and p-value scores using ANOVA F-test — get_scores_aov
title: Compute F-statistic and p-value scores using ANOVA F-test — get_scores_aov
text: Evaluate relationship numeric outcome categorical predictor, vice versa, computing ANOVA F-statistic p-value. Output tibble result one row per predictor, four columns: name, score, predictor, outcome.

title: Compute F-statistic and p-value scores using ANOVA F-test — get_scores_aov
Compute F-statistic and p-value scores using ANOVA F-test — get_scores_aov
text: score_obj score object. See score_aov() details. data data frame tibble containing outcome predictor variables. outcome character string specifying name outcome variable.

title: Compute F-statistic and p-value scores using ANOVA F-test — get_scores_aov
text: tibble result one row per predictor, four columns: name: name scoring metric. score: score predictor-outcome pair. predictor: name predictor. outcome: name outcome.

title: Compute F-statistic and p-value scores using ANOVA F-test — get_scores_aov
text: score_obj object may include following components: neg_log10 logical value indicating whether apply negative log10 transformation p-values (default TRUE). TRUE, p-values transformed -log10(pval). case: default fallback_value Inf default direction "maximize" FALSE, raw p-values used. case: fallback_value set 0 direction set "minimize"

title: Compute F-statistic and p-value scores using ANOVA F-test — get_scores_aov
code: data(ames, package = "modeldata") ames_subset <- modeldata::ames |>   dplyr::select(     Sale_Price,     MS_SubClass,     MS_Zoning,     Lot_Frontage,     Lot_Area,     Street   ) # Create a score object score_obj <- score_aov() score_res <- get_scores_aov(   score_obj,   data = ames_subset,   outcome = "Sale_Price" ) score_res #> # A tibble: 5 × 4 #>   name  score outcome    predictor    #>   <chr> <dbl> <chr>      <chr>        #> 1 fstat  64.0 Sale_Price MS_SubClass  #> 2 fstat  63.8 Sale_Price MS_Zoning    #> 3 fstat  NA   Sale_Price Lot_Frontage #> 4 fstat  NA   Sale_Price Lot_Area     #> 5 fstat  10.4 Sale_Price Street       # Change score type score_obj <- score_aov(score_type = "pval") score_res <- get_scores_aov(   score_obj,   data = ames_subset,   outcome = "Sale_Price" ) score_res #> # A tibble: 5 × 4 #>   name   score outcome    predictor    #>   <chr>  <dbl> <chr>      <chr>        #> 1 pval  167.   Sale_Price MS_SubClass  #> 2 pval   74.0  Sale_Price MS_Zoning    #> 3 pval   NA    Sale_Price Lot_Frontage #> 4 pval   NA    Sale_Price Lot_Area     #> 5 pval    2.90 Sale_Price Street       # Use raw p-values instead of -log10(p-values) score_obj <- score_aov(   score_type = "pval",   direction = "minimize",   fallback_value = 0 ) score_obj$neg_log10 <- FALSE # TODO Set neg_log10 = FALSE in score_aov()? score_res <- get_scores_aov(   score_obj,   data = ames_subset,   outcome = "Sale_Price" ) score_res #> # A tibble: 5 × 4 #>   name       score outcome    predictor    #>   <chr>      <dbl> <chr>      <chr>        #> 1 pval   1.62e-167 Sale_Price MS_SubClass  #> 2 pval   1.10e- 74 Sale_Price MS_Zoning    #> 3 pval  NA         Sale_Price Lot_Frontage #> 4 pval  NA         Sale_Price Lot_Area     #> 5 pval   1.27e-  3 Sale_Price Street

what: Construct a new score object — new_score_obj
title: Construct a new score object — new_score_obj
text: Create new score object contains associated metadata, range, fallback_value, score_type, direction, relevant attributes.

title: Construct a new score object — new_score_obj
code: new_score_obj(   subclass = c("cat_num", "cat_cat", "num_num", "any"),   outcome_type = c("numeric", "factor"),   predictor_type = c("numeric", "factor"),   case_weights = NULL,   range = NULL,   inclusive = NULL,   fallback_value = NULL,   score_type = NULL,   trans = NULL,   sorts = NULL,   direction = NULL,   deterministic = NULL,   tuning = NULL,   ties = NULL,   calculating_fn = NULL,   label = NULL,   ... )

title: Construct a new score object — new_score_obj
text: subclass character string indicating type predictor-outcome combination scoring method supports. One : "cat_num" "cat_cat" "num_num" "" outcome_type character string indicating outcome type. One : "numeric" "factor" predictor_type character string indicating predictor type. One : "numeric" "factor" case_weights logical value, indicating whether model accepts case weights (TRUE) (FALSE). range numeric vector length two, specifying minimum maximum possible values, respectively. inclusive logical vector length two, indicating whether lower upper bounds range inclusive (TRUE) exclusive (FALSE). fallback_value numeric scalar used fallback value. Typical values include: 0 1 Inf score_type character string indicating type scoring metric compute. Available options include: ANOVA F-Test: "fstat", "pval" Correlation: "pearson", "spearman" Cross Tabulation: "pval_chisq", "pval_fisher" Random Forest:"imp_rf", "imp_rf_conditional", "imp_rf_oblique" Information Gain: "infogain", "gainratio", "symuncert" ROC AUC: "roc_auc" trans NULL sorts optional function used sort scores. Common options include: identity abs function(score) max(score, 1 - score) direction character string indicating optimization direction. One : "maximize" "minimize" "target" deterministic logical value, indicating whether score deterministic (TRUE) (FALSE). tuning logical value, indicating whether model tuned (TRUE) (FALSE). ties optional logical value indicating whether ties score can occur (TRUE) (FALSE). calculating_fn optional function used compute score. default function selected based score_type. label named character string can used printing plotting. ... NULL

title: Construct a new score object — new_score_obj

what: Create a score object for ANOVA F-test F-statistics and p-values — score_aov
title: Create a score object for ANOVA F-test F-statistics and p-values — score_aov
text: Construct score object containing metadata univariate feature scoring using ANOVA F-test. Output score object containing associated metadata range, fallback_value, score_type ("fstat" "pval"), direction, relevant attributes.

title: Create a score object for ANOVA F-test F-statistics and p-values — score_aov
code: score_aov(   range = c(0, Inf),   fallback_value = Inf,   score_type = "fstat",   direction = "maximize" )

title: Create a score object for ANOVA F-test F-statistics and p-values — score_aov
text: range numeric vector length two, specifying minimum maximum possible values, respectively. fallback_value numeric scalar used fallback value. Typical values include: 0 Inf (default) F-statistics, fallback_value "Inf". p-values, since default applies negative log10 transformation p-values, fallback_value "Inf". score_type character string indicating type scoring metric compute. Available options include: "fstat" "pval" direction character string indicating optimization direction. One : "maximize" (default) "minimize" "target" F-statistics, direction "maximize". p-values, since default applies negative log10 transformation p-values, direction "maximize".

title: Create a score object for ANOVA F-test F-statistics and p-values — score_aov
text: score object containing associated metadata range, fallback_value, score_type ("fstat" "pval"), direction, relevant attributes.

title: Create a score object for ANOVA F-test F-statistics and p-values — score_aov
code: # Create a score object score_aov() #> ANOVA F-test F-statistics and p-values # Change score type score_aov(score_type = "pval") #> ANOVA F-test F-statistics and p-values
